channel.title: flynn walsh on flynn's site
channel.description: Recent content in flynn walsh on flynn's site

item.title: Pizza Dough
item.description: Ingredients (per ~12” pizza): 75g all purpose flour 75g 00 pizza flour (all purpose can be substituted) 5g salt 100g tap water 2g olive oil 1g yeast Procedure: Mix all ingredients in a large bowl, working until thoroughly combined. Let rest 15 minutes, then knead another 2 minutes. Rise 2-3 hours, divide if necessary, and shape. Dough lasts in the fridge for a day and weeks if frozen.

item.title: Dear Abby Cake
item.description: Cake Makes two moist and chocolatey 8” cake layers. Ingredients 3 oz. unsweetened chocolate (total 4 oz.) 1⁄2 cup butter (total 9 tbsp.) 1 cup water 2 cups cake flour (sifted) 1.25 tsp. baking soda 1 tsp. salt 2 eggs (total 5) 1 cup (8 oz.) sour cream 2 cups sugar (total 3 cups) 1.5 tsp. vanilla (total 3 tsp.) Procedure Preheat oven to 350 F. Melt 3 oz.

item.title: Building Vasp 5.4.4 on Ubuntu 16.04
item.description: VASP 5.4.4 streamlines compilation, but the official wiki intructions for Ubuntu 18.04 didn’t quite work for me and I haven’t seen anything else posted so I thought I’d share my notes. Instructions Install required libraries: sudo apt install make build-essential g++ gfortran sudo apt install libblas-dev liblapack-dev libopenmpi-dev libscalapack-mpi-dev libfftw3-dev libfftw3-3 libfftw3-mpi3 Uncompress and patch the source code: tar xvf vasp.5.4.4.tar.gz gunzip patch.5.4.4.16052018.gz mv patch.5.4.4.16052018 vasp.5.4.4 cd vasp.5.4.4 patch -p0 < patch.

item.title: Publicizing part of a git repo with hard links
item.description: I use private git repositories to sync and back up most of my scripts, settings, and notes. However, there are various files I’d like to make available for colleagues or application reviewers. After unsuccessfully playing around with submodules and branches as the internet seems to recommend, I found it easiest to create a new public repository in a separate directory in which I simply hard link to any files I want public.

item.title: My Sourdough Recipe
item.description: This 75% hydration, 15% whole wheat loaf draws from a mix of this King Arthur recipe and Ken Forkish’s Flour Water Salt Yeast. Ingredients: 300g 100% hydration starter (e.g.) 700g all purpose flour (I use King Arthur flours) 150g whole wheat flour 600g room temperature water 22g salt Procedure: Feed starter 4-6 hours before mixing—if starter is kept in a mason jar, it should be just about overflowing.
